titleStmt.title: Theodore M. Morgan to James W. Tate
CWG7759

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Collection House of MORGAN, HANSON & Co.,
N. E. corner Dock and Walnut streets, Philadelphia.
Notes and Drafts collected in all parts of North America through Banks and Bankers
Particular attention given to the Collection of past due claims through Attorneys.
Dishonored paper transferred to our Attorneys on day of dishonor when desired.
Philadelphia, October 2 1862
Jas. W Tate Esq.
Assis't. Secretary of State
Louisville
Ky.
Sir.
I rec'd this morning from your office, a Commission, authorizing me to take acknowledgement of Deeds, etc, for the State of Kentucky.
In compliance with the letter of instructions forwarded I have this day subscribed to the proper affidavit & herewith enclose it to be filed in your office.
With thanks for your Kind offices in the matter, I beg leave to subscribe myself.

Very Respectfully
Your Obd't. Sev't.
Theodore M Morgan
